column4: how do I get the network manager applet to show?  I installed gnome-network-manager
Or log out and back in.

I've used network-manager applet before and I thought it showed a list of available access points when you click on it.  when I click on this icon it doesnt show a list of access points, it just lets me configure the interface through the ubuntu network-admin, am I missing something?
yeah but it just gives one grey-ed out choice that says wired network
Right click-> Enable wireless, if it's disabled?
I only have "enable networking" and it's checked
Is the wireless card working otherwise?
Edit /etc/network/interfaces and comment out any lines that say anything about the interfaces.
yes!  thanks a lot, that worked
I had the same problem when I tried to enable network-manager, a while ago.
